articles.headline: Virginia Shooting Suspect Was Distraught Over Trump’s Election, Brother Says
articles.snippet: James Thomas Hodgkinson, 66, of Belleville, Ill., who died after a shootout with the police, had traveled to Washington in recent weeks to protest, his brother said.
articles.abstract: James Thomas Hodgkinson, 66, of Belleville, Ill., who died after a shootout with the police, had traveled to Washington in recent weeks to protest, his brother said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — He lived out of his van in the Northern Virginia suburbs and took showers at the Y.M.C.A. On Facebook, he posted furious criticism of President Trump and pledged allegiance to Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont. Back home in Illinois, neighbors complained to the police of his practicing his shooting near their home.

articles.headline: The Universal Phenomenon of Men Interrupting Women
articles.snippet: An Uber board member’s claim that female directors talk too much and the cutting short of Kamala Harris at a Senate hearing illustrate an experience that academic studies confirm.
articles.abstract: An Uber board member’s claim that female directors talk too much and the cutting short of Kamala Harris at a Senate hearing illustrate an experience that academic studies confirm.
articles.lead_paragraph: For women in business and beyond, it was an I-told-you-so day.

articles.headline: Mueller Seeks to Talk to Intelligence Officials, Hinting at Inquiry of Trump
articles.snippet: The special counsel’s request for interviews with three officials is the latest indication he will investigate whether the president obstructed justice.
articles.abstract: The special counsel’s request for interviews with three officials is the latest indication he will investigate whether the president obstructed justice.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Robert S. Mueller III, the special counsel examining Russia’s meddling in the 2016 election, has requested interviews with three high-ranking current or former intelligence officials, the latest indication that he will investigate whether President Trump obstructed justice, a person briefed on the investigation said on Wednesday.
articles.byline: By Michael S. Schmidt and Matt Apuzzo

articles.headline: Shooting Is Latest Eruption in a Grim Ritual of Rage and Blame
articles.snippet: The attack on lawmakers in Virginia was less an aberration than the latest example of a grim trend, widely remarked upon by leaders in both parties, but never slowed or stopped.
articles.abstract: The attack on lawmakers in Virginia was less an aberration than the latest example of a grim trend, widely remarked upon by leaders in both parties, but never slowed or stopped.
articles.lead_paragraph: The violence has come regularly for years, in one politically charged spasm after another. A member of Congress shot through the head in Tucson. Assaults on the Holocaust Museum, a Planned Parenthood office and the Family Research Council, a socially conservative group. Gunmen targeting black churchgoers in South Carolina, Indian immigrants in Kansas and police officers in New York and Texas.

articles.headline: The Dutch Have Solutions to Rising Seas. The World Is Watching.
articles.snippet: In the waterlogged Netherlands, climate change is considered neither a hypothetical nor a drag on the economy. Instead, it’s an opportunity.
articles.abstract: In the waterlogged Netherlands, climate change is considered neither a hypothetical nor a drag on the economy. Instead, it’s an opportunity.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the waterlogged Netherlands, climate change is considered neither a hypothetical nor a drag on the economy. Instead, it’s an opportunity.
articles.byline: By Michael Kimmelman and Josh Haner

articles.headline: Did the Jack Welch Model Sow Seeds of G.E.’s Decline?
articles.snippet: Mr. Welch’s successor, Jeffrey R. Immelt, failed to capture the same leadership aura. But it may be that the idea of a conglomerate was unsustainable.
articles.abstract: Mr. Welch’s successor, Jeffrey R. Immelt, failed to capture the same leadership aura. But it may be that the idea of a conglomerate was unsustainable.
articles.lead_paragraph: For Fortune magazine in 1999, Jack Welch, then General Electric’s chief executive, wasn’t just the country’s best executive, or the manager of the year, but nothing less than the best manager of the 20th century, “far and away the most influential manager of his generation.”
